results.title: For you madam = Pour vous madame
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items: 1. Connaissance de la France - celebrates France’s 8th century first gothic building, Sants Cathedral, consecrated by Pope Alexander III in 1164. 2. In 1940, France’s National Geographical Institute set out to make a new map of the country, scheduled for completion in 1980. This segment focuses on the project’s progress. 3. Looks at an exhibition of masterpieces hosted by a French regional gallery which will eventually reach the Louvre. 4. ‘Foire de Paris = Paris Fair’ - presents some of the highlights. 5. Visits a bull-ring in Southern France which although controversial, attracts thousands of spectators. Shows the different stages of a bull-fight.

results.title: Football faux pas
results.brief_description: Migraine Murphy is the imaginery coach of a grid-iron team famous for the mistakes it makes. In humourous fashion the film shows the fumbles, the dropped catches, the clumsiness etc of his team using real game footage. Also shows how things can go wrong in the pre-game razz-ma-tazz.

results.title: Food of Southeast Asia
results.brief_description: Follows the activities of the children of three families to show how fish, rice and vegetables - the main foods of Southeast Asia - are produced. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Follow my leader
results.brief_description: A Girl Guide Company requires a new leader. No-one is available so the Company carries on as best it can. Finally the Guides erect notices promoting a display of what they do and before too long they get a volunteer for a new leader and also new recruits.

results.title: Flying the flag : the story of the Eureka flag
results.creator_credit: Jo Lane, Debra Annear and Vixen Films
results.brief_description: This production examines the events associated with the Eureka Stockade, which occurred at Ballarat, Victoria, on 3rd December 1854. The Eureka flag was unfurled by protesting diggers on Bakery Hill prior to the Stockade, a potent symbol of their fight for democracy and human rights in a new land. The issues investgated include the flag’s design, manufacture, conservation and the sometimes debatable uses made of it by political groups. This video draws in a wealth of material provided by the Ballarat Fine Art Gallery and the Public Record Office of Victoria, as well as interviews with a number of people directly associated with conserving and promoting the flag in the 20th century.
